fields.description: The link to the "API Documentation" page in the Project Release Notes section of the JIRA Administrators' Guide is broken.
fields.summary: Broken Link in Documentation
sort order of comments in issue view is not working in 3.12.3
"Non Quoted Comment Handler" doesn't behave as expected with the reporterusername setting

fields.description: With the 'Participants' field configured as a column in issue navigator, when changing to 'Printable' view the field is not shown
fields.summary: 'Participants' Custom Field not viewable on 'Printable' Issue Navigator view

fields.description:
I am trying to access a JIRA project through mobile devices. A use case for this is using JIRA as a workflow tool for people out of office, for incident management purpose.

In order to run ActiveX control on a mobile device (such as a Symbian 3.0 o Windows mobile 6.0 smartphone), ActiveX should be compiled on ARM platform.
I can't figure out if this is supported, already available or out of scope. 
This is not a request of a lightweight GUI similar to CONF-7644 or JRA-12233

Thanks in advance, regards
fields.summary: ActiveX on WinMobile or Symbian3
Make single level group by report available in word and excel formats

fields.description:
If there is a custom field -user picker defined in the browse project section in permission scheme, then people who do not normally have permissions to view the project (and would not see the project on the dash) do see the project.

Removing the custom field user-picker from the permission scheme does remove the visibility of the project.

Confirmed behavior on client's dev instance via webex and on test

If there are multiple issues in the project, the unprived user can see what he actually does have perm to see (i.e. if he is defined as a user in the custom field that is in browse project section), but if there are 0 issues that he has access to, he is still aware of the project.

Reported in [JSP-23027|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-23027]
fields.summary: Users without permissions can browse projects that they do not have perms to if custom field-user picker

fields.description:
We get a lot of spam to our email support project in JIRA, which I use the bulk operation feature to delete.  However, sometimes I accidentally select a real issue as well, and don't notice until the confirmation screen.  Then I have to go back to the beginning to deselect the issue.

Instead, it would be nice if there were a way to remove an issue from the bulk operation without leaving the confirmation screen.
fields.summary: allow a way to deselect issues from the bulk issue confirmation scheme

fields.description:
Hi,

I would like a custom field type that lists all the existing issues in a combo box, of which I can select one. Much like the "Project Picker" custom field type.
Maybe even have it in a cascading combo box style (first combo box = Projects, second combo box = Issues).

i know you can Link Issues, but that's not really what I want.
Would it be possible to add this in a future release of JIRA?

Many thanks, kind regards,
Eric
fields.summary: Is it possible to create a Custom Field Type of "Issue" ?

fields.description:
When performing a fuzzy search with {{(i.e: dummy ~1)}} keyword,  the following error messages prompted:

{noformat}
org.apache.jasper.JasperException: minimumSimilarity >= 1
at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.handleJspException(JspServletWrapper.java:512)
at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.service(JspServletWrapper.java:377)
at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.serviceJspFile(JspServlet.java:314)
at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.service(JspServlet.java:264)
at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:802)
{noformat}
fields.summary: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: minimumSimilarity >= 1 when performing a fuzzy search
Investigate if table scans on the configuration context could cause performance issues

fields.description:
When I create a filter which is sorted on 3 columns (whose a column is "Fixed version"), the issues are not sorted as wanted.
And impossible to reset the sorting, for example, impossible to have a sort on only one column, or only two columns.

This issue could be linked to this JRA-3219 issue.
fields.summary: Sort on several columns doesn't work

fields.description: Is there any use case where a 0 minute service interval is applicable?  Some users accidentally set it to 0 (like the mail handler service) and the CPU usage spikes to 100% each time they start JIRA.
fields.summary: Limit Service Interval Values

fields.description:
While adding/editing Service to use CC plugin, length of service properties field "ClearCase VOB Paths:" is limited to 256 chars.
We definitely need more to accommodate all paths to the CC VOBs.
Error:
Error occurred trying to update service properties: com.opensymphony.module.propertyset.IllegalPropertyException: String exceeds 255 characters.

WORK AROUND:
Trying to create a 2nd instance of the same service(plugin) is not allowed.
Service class: net.sf.jiraext.plugin.clearcase.services.ClearCaseIndexService
Error:
Cannot add service - service already exists, and service specifies that it must be unique.
fields.summary: Error occurred trying to update service properties: String exceeds 255 chars

fields.description:
We are trying to find the function for blocking mail from anonymous senders, creating comments into open issues in JIRA.

The funcion we mainly need this for is to prevent an possible flood of comments into issues created by the "Out of office" setting in outlook this summer holidays. The scenario ( and I would be surprised if you have not heard this before ). :

A person is a project member, he is on holiday and has enabled the out-of-office function in his outlook. Another project member is making a comment in the project which produces a mail to all watchers of the project. The outlook of the person on holiday bounces back a mail to Jira that he is on holiday. This mail ends up as a comment in the project and Jira sends a confirmation back to the user... ...

How do we stop this?

//Michael Friman
fields.summary: Improve handlers to filter out "Out of Office" replies
Allow to select which columns (issue fields) are shown in the version workload report and the time-tracking report

fields.description:
The Sort Order arrow on the View Issue page does not do anything.

The link for the error just goes to the View Issue page without any other parameters.
fields.summary: Sort Order for comments, worklogs, and any other issue tab is broken

fields.description: We should be using the latest backport-util-concurrent.
fields.summary: Update backport-util-concurrent to 3.1

fields.description:
A support customer has lost thousands of attachments from his JIRA instance for reasons unknown. He recognises that we do state in our [backup documentation|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/automated_backups.html] that attachments are not in the database, however he suggests that we elevate this statement to a warning so that it is really clear.

This seems like a good idea to me.
fields.summary: Make the warning more prominent that attachments are not backed up

fields.description:
If you reply to email, that was generated for comment with some level of visibility set Jira will generate comment with option visible to all. It should retain the same visibility as it was for the original email.
Because of the reseting of visibility level we can not replay to Jira emails at all :(.
fields.summary: Reply to email generated by Jira should retain level of visibility as set by original comment, now it resets to visible to all

fields.description: I'm suggesting a feature where subtasks would have a key like WRK-12#2, where 2 is the second subtask for issue WRK-12. This way it's much easier to associate a subtask with the main issue only by reading the key.
fields.summary: Sub-taks key naming to WRK-12#2

fields.description:
We are getting the following error while try to add a cvs module
"Error parsing cvs log: Invalid branch revision:0.42 " 
CVS Details:
Module Name - oms/ws
CVSROOT=:pserver:username@hostname:/home/eqcvs/cmte
Log Retrieval - I would like to update the log myself 
Logfile PATH - /home/chgmgmt/jiraeqprod/cvs_path/autosys/cst.log

We had raised a support case with Atlassian support and as per them, it's happening in cases where the CVS log contains a branch revision beginning with 0.*. 

Please refer to https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-17426 for further details
fields.summary: Can't add cvs module if log contains branch revision beginning with 0.*

fields.description:
If a post-function is added to any workflow to re-assign the default assignee at the initial create transition, the function will silently fail and the issue will remain assigned to the project default assignee or the component default assignee.

At other transitions the 'update issue field' does perform as expected. 

Other related post-functions at the 'issue create' transition do work as expected, such as the 'Assign to Reporter' post-function. Testing against other combinations has not been exhaustive.
fields.summary: The 'update issue field' workflow post-function on 'Assignee' does not work at the initial 'create issue' transition

fields.description: When working on a large project, its often handy to see what the graph of issue dependencies are. Currently we generate a Graphviz representation by hand.
fields.summary: Ability to Visualize dependencies with JIRA issues

fields.description:
You can go to Administration > Plugins and disable the workflow plugin:

!DisablingWorkflowPlugin.png!

Once you have done this, the post-functions tab on a workflow transition changes from the normal:

!PostFunctionsEnabled.png!

to this:

!PostFunctionsDisabled.png!

And if you go to add a post function to the transition, there are no post functions to add:

!AddPostFunctionDisabled.png!

We should not let administrators disable the workflow plugin. There is no reason why they should be able to.

There are probably other affects of disabling the workflow plugin. I didn't go looking.
fields.summary: Stop administrators from disabling the Workflow plugin

fields.description:
We are currently using an old fork of the JCAPTCHA library (due to a licensing concerns). Upgrade to the latest version which is LGPL.

Also, use a MemoryStore rather than a disk backed EhCache store. This prevents the need for multiple JIRAs running on the same box to have a unique temp directory configured or potentially clobber each other's cache files.
fields.summary: Upgrade JCaptcha to 1.0 RC6 and use MemoryStore

fields.description:
Normal applications with web UIs (hotmail, wikipedia, most web forms of recent vintage) don't have this problem.
Unsaved Comments are lost when I go back to a page where I had typed in but not saved my input.

Seen in 3.12.2 Pro and here (3.12.3 Enterprise)

How to reproduce.
Start adding a comment to this issue.  (I.e. type some stuff into the comment field, but don't hit add.)
Click to create a subtask, and do so.  
Come back expecting to be able to save the comments you entered earlier by hitting add.
The comments will have disappeared, s

I am NOT interested in a workaround.  Most major apps, like bugzilla, don't have this problem.  

Perhaps its an expiration meta tag set by the web server?

In firefox, when using other web apps, I can even type some data into a form, CLOSE the webpage it's on, and re-open it using History...Recently Closed Tabs, and find what I've typed in is still there!
fields.summary: Unsaved Comments lost when I go back to a page where I had typed in but not saved my input.

fields.description:
Just tried to reindex, just got the attached message.

Tried restarting the service, but no joy.
fields.summary: Reindex problem

fields.description:
I would love a counter, that starts when you press "start progress" and then stops the count when pressing "Stop Progress". It will sum up the spent time concurrent with the work being done. - Ergo: If I go into a task five minutes in, I will see five minutes spent. If I go in ten minutes after that I will see fifteen minutes spent. When the "Stop progress" is pressed, the sum up will stop. 
Then you only need to enter the "extra" time spent on an issue. - And the actual spent time when working on the issue, will automatically be filled out. 
It would save us coders a LOT of clicks and entering when working on small bugs and issues.

Just to be crystal clear:
This is regarding starting / stopping the progress on an issue when a coder / supporter is working on an issue. Today he/she has to manually enter the time spent wheter the start/stop progress is pressed or not. - we would like a sum of the spent time to start when pressing start progress. - This way the reporter can follow the time spent and the assignee does not have to manually fill out this field afterwards since that part is done by JIRA automatically.

We could REALLY use this feature.

Thanks a bunch in advance. - And thanks for a fantastic tool. JIRA has already made our lives a bit easier.
Have a great weekend and I hope to see this request implemented in the future.
If you have any questions do not hesitate to send me a mail.

/Jens Bay
fields.summary: Automatic Work logging.

fields.description:
I have JIRA and Confluence configured to send Trackbacks to each other, however because the server they are hosted on does not have access to the internet, the trackbacks to www.w3.org fail with the following appearing in the log.

{noformat}
2/05/2008 14:08:47 com.atlassian.trackback.DefaultTrackbackFinder findPingUrls
WARNING: Unable to connect to 'http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance': java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out
java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Native Method)
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.doConnect(PlainSocketImpl.java:333)
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connectToAddress(PlainSocketImpl.java:195)
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(PlainSocketImpl.java:182)
	at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(SocksSocketImpl.java:366)
	at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:519)
	at java.net.Socket.connect(Socket.java:469)
	at java.net.Socket.<init>(Socket.java:366)
	at java.net.Socket.<init>(Socket.java:239)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.protocol.DefaultProtocolSocketFactory.createSocket(DefaultProtocolSocketFactory.java:79)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.protocol.DefaultProtocolSocketFactory.createSocket(DefaultProtocolSocketFactory.java:121)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpConnection.open(HttpConnection.java:706)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeWithRetry(HttpMethodDirector.java:386)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeMethod(HttpMethodDirector.java:170)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:396)
	at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:324)
	at com.atlassian.trackback.TrackbackUtils.getUrlContent(TrackbackUtils.java:149)
	at com.atlassian.trackback.DefaultTrackbackFinder.findPingUrls(DefaultTrackbackFinder.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.trackback.DefaultTrackbackFinder.findPingUrls(DefaultTrackbackFinder.java:25)
	at com.atlassian.trackback.DefaultTrackbackHelper.pingTrackbacksInContent(DefaultTrackbackHelper.java:27)
	at com.atlassian.jira.trackback.TrackbackMailQueueItem.send(TrackbackMailQueueItem.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.mail.queue.MailQueueImpl.sendBuffer(MailQueueImpl.java:68)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailQueueService.run(MailQueueService.java:23)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.JiraServiceContainerImpl.run(JiraServiceContainerImpl.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.ServiceRunner.execute(ServiceRunner.java:61)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:191)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:516)
2/05/2008 14:12:32 org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector executeWithRetry
INFO: I/O exception (java.net.ConnectException) caught when processing request: Connection timed out
{noformat}

I think this might be an issue with Confluence, also, but I'm not seeing any stacktraces that show an issue there, so i'm not sure. Maybe once JIRA is fixed, Confluence will just work? :)

The workaround is to configure a docroot with these files and set up a fake hosts entry pointing to localhost. If you have a better workaround, that'd be cool. :)
fields.summary: Trackbacks that fail if server has no internet connectivity cause undue log warnings

fields.description:
If one tries to configure JIRA with the LDAP configuration tool (JIRA ent) and a user supplied in _Sample user to authenticate_ doesn't have the search permission on the LDAP repository, JIRA will report the following error in the UI:
{noformat}
Initial connect and search successful, but second phase connection to LDAP as 'CN=Test,CN=Users,dc=test,dc=local' failed (error: javax.naming.NameNotFoundException: [LDAP: error code 32 - 0000208D: NameErr: DSID-03151EFD, problem 2001 (NO_OBJECT), data 0, best match of: 'CN=Users,DC=test,DC=local' �]; remaining name 'CN=Test,CN=Users,dc=test,dc=local'. More in logs)
{noformat}

and in the log file is recoded:
{noformat}
2008-05-02 12:53:12,922 http-8080-Processor23 INFO [web.action.util.LDAPConfigurer] javax.naming.NameNotFoundException: [LDAP: error code 32 - 0000208D: NameErr: DSID-03151EFD, problem 2001 (NO_OBJECT), data 0, best match of:
        'CN=Users,DC=test,DC=local'
]; remaining name 'CN=Test,CN=Users,dc=test,dc=local'
javax.naming.NameNotFoundException: [LDAP: error code 32 - 0000208D: NameErr: DSID-03151EFD, problem 2001 (NO_OBJECT), data 0, best match of:
        'CN=Users,DC=test,DC=local'
]; remaining name 'CN=Test,CN=Users,dc=test,dc=local'
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtx.mapErrorCode(LdapCtx.java:3030)
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtx.processReturnCode(LdapCtx.java:2951)
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtx.processReturnCode(LdapCtx.java:2758)
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtx.searchAux(LdapCtx.java:1807)
        at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtx.c_search(LdapCtx.java:1735)
        at com.sun.jndi.toolkit.ctx.ComponentDirContext.p_search(ComponentDirContext.java:368)
        at com.sun.jndi.toolkit.ctx.PartialCompositeDirContext.search(PartialCompositeDirContext.java:338)
        at com.sun.jndi.toolkit.ctx.PartialCompositeDirContext.search(PartialCompositeDirContext.java:321)
        at javax.naming.directory.InitialDirContext.search(InitialDirContext.java:248)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.util.LDAPConfigurer.ldapAuthenticate(LDAPConfigurer.java:211)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.util.LDAPConfigurer.doValidation(LDAPConfigurer.java:124)
        at webwork.action.ActionSupport.validate(ActionSupport.java:373)
        at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:150)
        at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.execute(JiraActionSupport.java:54)
        at webwork.dispatcher.GenericDispatcher.executeAction(GenericDispatcher.java:132)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.dispatcher.JiraServletDispatcher.service(JiraServletDispatcher.java:211)
{noformat}

Although, if one manually creates {{osuser.xml}} the same user as used in the test as _Sample user to authenticate_  is authenticated correctly against the LDAP repository.

In other words, issue is experienced only if LDAPConfigurer is used and opensymphony seems to be OK.
fields.summary: LDAP configuration tool fails to test correctly connection to repository

fields.description:
After upgrades, sometimes you find certain plugins don't work or some subtle piece of functionality is failing and maybe you don't notice for a few days. After even one day of Customer Support we might have 500 new issues in Jira. This makes rolling back to the old database backup a bad idea.

It would be nice if there were some sort of tool to take an exported XML file and downgrade it to a previous version that could be re-imported.

Certainly not a trivial thing but it would be cool to have such a thing!
fields.summary: Ability to downgrade versions

fields.description: When you go to delete a user it lists their 'Filters Created'. When that user has zero filters created it still lists a number which happens to be the number of public filters that the user has access to.
fields.summary: Deleting user screen misleading re: filter count

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14898].
  {panel}

I used to think it was just me, but I've noticed a lot of people succumb to this UI issue.
When using the Link Issue screen, the type selector defaults to "blocks".  For some reason I often forget to change the link type to what I mean it to be.  I have no explanation for why I skip that step, but now that I know it's a common problem, I'd like to request a change.

There should be no link type selected by default.
If the form is submitted without specifying a link type, the user should be told they need to specify a link type.  (I'm guessing this happens already since the user could presumably deselect "blocks")

Cons:
* people who want "blocks" would have to click it.

Pros:
* dumbasses like me would no longer have to delete their blocks and recreate whatever they meant to create.
fields.summary: The Link Issues UI leads to spurious "blocks" links
More options for default assignee
Clarify rules for partial trusted apps path matches

fields.description:
Sometimes customers have already created a support case in https;//support.atlassian.com, and then we ask them to append their logs and/or an XML backup. Some customers find this a little challenging, in which case we ask them to create a support request from within their JIRA instance.

It would be great in the circumstance of when there is already a support case, that the user be able to specify the key of an existing issue in https://support.atlassian.com, and instead of creating a new case, https://support.atlassian.com appended the attachments to the existing issue, and added the subject, description and all other fields into a comment on the existing issue.

I tested if this works already, by using the key of an existing issue in the subject. It doesn't work. A new issue is created.
fields.summary: Allow support request from within JIRA to become a comment on an existing support case

fields.description:
We have just upgraded to Jira 3.12.2 and like the new functionality when adding watchers to an issue.
There is one problem with this though. It is showing all users, including users with no permissions. This means that all employees that stopped working here will show in the drop down. We do not want this. Is there any existing workaround for this?
fields.summary: Manage Watchers shows users with no permission
Do not render a hyperlink for a change history item for linking issues when the user does not have permissions to see the linked issue

fields.description:
The OSWorkflow manager uses a HashSet for caching. The trouble is that the hashset is not cloned when it is returned, so if it is updated, the code that is iterating over the cache can get a ConcurrentModificationException.
{noformat}
2008-04-29 10:57:40,966 
resin-tcp-connection-j2ee.jira.atlassian.com:8080-57 ERROR 
[webwork.util.ServletValueStack] METHOD: "searcherEditHtml", exception:
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
        at java.util.HashMap$HashIterator.nextEntry(HashMap.java:793)
        at java.util.HashMap$KeyIterator.next(HashMap.java:827)
        at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getSchemeActiveWorkflows(OSWorkflowManager.java:143)
        at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getActiveWorkflows(OSWorkflowManager.java:121)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.impl.StatusSearcher.getSelectListOptions(StatusSearcher.java:45)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.impl.GenericConstantsSearcher.getEditHtml(GenericConstantsSearcher.java:80)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.IssueNavigator.getSearcherEditHtml(IssueNavigator.java:544)
{noformat}
fields.summary: Concurrency problem in workflow cache
Force lowercase via javascript in the user add page

fields.description:
The CreateIssue Jelly Tag fail to create issue if the new priority using number. For example:

Existing priority in my JIRA:

1) Blocker
2) Major
3) Minor
4) Trivial
5) 10000 

{noformat}
<JiraJelly xmlns:jira="jelly:com.atlassian.jira.jelly.JiraTagLib">
<jira:CreateIssue project-key="ABC" assignee="-1" summary="Issue summary" priority="10000">
<!-- other jelly tags -->
</jira:CreateIssue>
</JiraJelly>
{noformat}

JIRA will somehow treat 10000 as the id of the priority.
fields.summary: CreateIssue Jelly Tag not working properly if priority name is using number

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14886].
  {panel}

At the moment JIRA does not (natively) allow connections to email servers using TLS (Such as gmail)

It appears that this functionality is available if configured using the JNDI service. So this report is just a feature request from an interested, reviewing user.

[LOG: "
An error has occurred with sending the test email:
com.atlassian.mail.MailException: com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPSendFailedException: 530 5.7.0 Must issue a STARTTLS command first. 30sm14326411wff.11
"]
fields.summary: Support for TLS Connections within JIRAs own Mail Handler

fields.description: Click create sub task, then next, then change your mind about the type of sub task and click back. Select a new sub task and click next. Nothing happens
fields.summary: Back button doesn't work when creating sub tasks

fields.description: Add *alt* attribute to *img* tags that display the flags on the setup screen.
fields.summary: Add alternative text to images of language flags on the setup screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14883].
  {panel}

We have two types of JIRA users:
- Developers
- Users
Developers like the full-featured HTML JIRA emails, which include full interaction with the system.

Users are scared by them, and want less, but not format-less, emails.

Unfortunately, if we change the templates in webapp/WEB-INF/classes/templates/**/*.vm, that's a global thing. It would be much better from our perspective if we could define multiple templates (like "text", "full_html", and "minimal_html") and assign that to users and/or projects, rather than just full-html or text.
fields.summary: Multiple email templates, chosen on per-user level

fields.description:
I have added a 'Time Since Issues' graph to my dashboard with the following settings:
- a filter for all issues in the project
- Cumulative Totals= Yes
- Days previously = 100
- Period: daily
- Date field: created

As I want to see the rate of issues being logged over time.
The graph has the right values in it, however the summary text below is summing all the cumulative counts, rather than displaying the cumulative value.
ie 'Today' in the graph has 378 created issues (which is correct)
The text underneath reads: 'Issues : 15962 created'

Screenshot will be attached
fields.summary: Time Since Issues graph text showing sum figure instead of cumulative figure
Export single issue to Excel
how to get all user list from jira soap service without admin permission?

fields.description:
If for a given filed wiki renderer is enabled e.g. Comments,  _jira.projectkey.pattern_ in {{jira-application.properties}} is configured in the following way:

jira.projectkey.pattern = (([A-Z]|[0-9]){3,})

and a user enters into the filed a string  that contains the dash character for e.g.

!screenshot-1.jpg!

the character before dash is duplicated when filed is previewed or sent to JIRA for e.g.

!screenshot-2.jpg!
fields.summary: Character before dash (minus (-)) gets duplicated by wiki renderer

fields.description: I wish to use a mail service to collect mail from POP and then add the email body as comments to the issue specified by key in the mail subject. This is easy, however I wish to add comment level security set to 'group-x only' for all those comments. Is this possible to set up in the service?
fields.summary: Mail service with comment security applied

fields.description:
See JRA-7156 for a related issue with creating links.
This was fixed for link creation but the bug still exists for link deletion.

After deleting a link, the correct "updated date" is stored in the DB, but the lucene index is not updated.

The user will see the correct date when viewing an issue, but they will see the old value in lists, searches etc that use the Lucene index.
fields.summary: Deleting a link changes the "updated date" field, but it does not reindex lucene.

fields.description:
Our organisation uses 7.5 hour work days by default.
Currently Time Tracking allows to configure either 7 or 8 hours per day.
The resolution should be improved to allow at least 3omin or even 15min configurations to Time Tracking.
fields.summary: Better resolution to Time Tracking properties

fields.description: When I go to Administration --> General Configuration and click Edit, a field comes up to edit the Introduction portlet.  Ours is quite long (SAC), and cuts off part of the bottom.  It only seems to happen on Mac, and with Firefox.  Windows+Firefox is fine, and Mac+Safari is fine.
fields.summary: In Firefox on OS X, editing a long Introduction under Administration --> General Configuration causes some of the field to be truncated
Change 500 error message to refer to full application server log file (e.g. logs/catalina.out) instead of atlassian-jira.log

fields.description:
We get many support cases along the lines of, "I reconfigured JIRA to use <database X> instead of HSQL, and now I get 404 errors.".

Most of these cases turn out to be one of:
- missing JDBC driver
- invalid XML in server.xml or entityengine.xml
- wrong database username or password 
- database permissions problem - e.g. can't create tables

I think a GUI interface to configure the database connection would make it easier for customers and help reduce the number of support cases. This GUI interface should be in two places:

# In the [installer|JRA-14868], for the case when the customer wants to set up JIRA from the start to be using a proper database rather than HSQL.
# In JIRA itself (in the administration interface), for the case when the customer has been evaluating JIRA using HSQL, and now wants to move to a real database to use JIRA in anger.

In this interface, we could ask the customer for:
- database type
- database server DNS name or IP address
- database name
- username 
- password

We could use the database type to check whether the correct JDBC driver is in the classpath, and if not, we could prompt the user for the location of the JDBC driver (and we could copy it into common/lib). We should also ship with any JDBC drivers that we are allowed to (MySQL and Postgres?).

We could also test the connection to the database, giving the customer immediate feedback of whether their parameters are valid.

The connection wizard in [DBVisualizer|http://www.minq.se/products/dbvis/] is a good example of such an interface.

I realize that there are technical issues to solve around whether you would then update app server config files (e.g. conf/server.xml) and entityengine.xml, or whether you would use a completely different mechanism to save the database connection configuration. But it is all do-able.
fields.summary: GUI interface for configuring the database connection

fields.description:
We have configurated JIRA with one custom field of type User Picker. But JIRA doesn't allow to search issues with empty value of this field.

Could you please help?
fields.summary: Ability to specify empty username in User Picker

fields.description: The title of one of our defects has the word <FACILITY> in it. When viewing this defect in the Print Friendly view, the word <FACILITY> is not shown.
fields.summary: Print Friendly View does not handle Less Than and Greater Than symbols

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create filter.
2. Edit filter's column order. (delete or change order of columns) Save filter.
3. Export current fields to excel. (Attachment: "ExportToExcelTest+Atlassian+JIRA.xls")
3. Sort by column 'Reporter'.
4. Export current fields to excel. (Attachment: "Atlassian+JIRA-1.xls")

As you can see the second excel file contains the default column order, but I expected the copy of the current view.

This also affects the "Printable" view.
fields.summary: Export Current_fields to Excel use default column order instead filter's order after modification of the current view

fields.description:
* Make it for all platforms, not just for Windows.
* Add GUI interfaces for configuring:
** database 
** LDAP
** Crowd
** proxy server
* Make the GUI interfaces accessible in JIRA as well as the installer.
* Add support for upgrading - i.e. the installer goes hunting for existing JIRA instances on the box and asks if you want to copy over the configuration from it.

Many of our support cases are related to installation and upgrade issues. A better installer would help.
fields.summary: Improve the installer

fields.description:
* If there is a project custom field configured,
* and the value for a particular issue is set to a project which the current user does not have permission to browse,

then when the user goes to edit the issue, the custom field will not contain the option of the currently set value, since the user does not have permission. Because of this, even if the user does not modify the value of the field, when they save the issue, the current value will be replaced with whatever is selected.

A possible solution to this would be to have an extra list option which has the text "Keep current value" (or something similar) and the value of the currently selected project. If we implement this solution, we need to ensure that the searcher options do not also have this extra option.
fields.summary: Project CF value can be lost if user doesnt have permission to browse the selected project and they attempt to edit the issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14866].
  {panel}

We are a small company , and we are using Google for mail , calender etc ...
For now we are using open ldap to authenticate users for our Jira
But we would like to have a sort of SSO , using google users and password
It will be great to be able to configure Jira , to check the users password against Goolge

Even some instructions , how you did the ldap integration , would be fine
fields.summary: Implement login using google Authentication

fields.description:
The Bugzilla schema has had a field named "disableduser" in the profiles table since at least v2.10, i.e. almost every instance in the field has this field. When a user is marked as disabled in Bugzilla, some text is entered into this field. This information could be used to create the user differently when importing data from Bugzilla into JIRA. For instance, the email address could be made invalid in an RFC-approved manner, the user could be created but not added to jira-users.

The business case for this is that it's a right pain to have to deactivate hundreds of users by hand after the import!
fields.summary: Detect deactivated users during a Bugzilla import

fields.description:
In [JRA-4074|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-4074], JIRA was improved to include more specific actions when an issue type can't changed unless it was moved.

This message only seems to appear when there are no other Issue Types in the drop list when you edit an issue.  

Would it be feasible to add a similar message when there _is_ more than one issue type in the drop down list?
fields.summary: Improve User Message if Issue Type can't be changed in "Edit Issue"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14860].
  {panel}

We are wanting to use groups to help collect different types of ISSUE types together. An Example of this would be:
(Group) Product Backlog contains issues (Requirement, Feature, Improvement)
(group) Sprint Backlog contains issues (Bug, Task, Test Case)

This could then be used to better generate reports and filters for different projects.

This would be very useful for burn down reports.
fields.summary: Grouping Issue Types together

fields.description: Release notes can be generated via the "http://bugs.tradespeed.com:8080/secure/ReleaseNote.jspa?" url, but I would like to programmatically generate release notes for any version, using the SOAP interface to retrieve the issues that are fixed in a specific version.
fields.summary: Have a method to generate release notes

fields.description:
Browsing to a URL with a stale or invalid project id, e.g.:
{noformat}/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&pid=99999{noformat}

will cause an ERROR to appear in the logs similar to this:
{noformat}ERROR [webwork.util.ServletValueStack] METHOD: "searcherEditHtml", exception: 
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Cannot get schemes for null project
	at com.atlassian.jira.scheme.AbstractSchemeManager.getSchemes(AbstractSchemeManager.java:172)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager.getWorkflowScheme(DefaultWorkflowSchemeManager.java:77)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getWorkflowName(OSWorkflowManager.java:87)
	at com.atlassian.jira.workflow.OSWorkflowManager.getWorkflow(OSWorkflowManager.java:213)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.impl.StatusSearcher.getSelectListOptions(StatusSearcher.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.searchers.impl.GenericConstantsSearcher.getEditHtml(GenericConstantsSearcher.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.IssueNavigator.getSearcherEditHtml(IssueNavigator.java:544)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor387.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils$DefaultInjectionImpl.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:61)
	at webwork.util.InjectionUtils.invoke(InjectionUtils.java:52)
	at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:426)
	at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:175)
	at webwork.view.taglib.WebWorkBodyTagSupport.findValue(WebWorkBodyTagSupport.java:61)
	at webwork.view.taglib.BasicPropertyTag.doStartTag(BasicPropertyTag.java:54)
	at _jsp._includes._navigator._filter_22dform__jsp._jspService(_filter_22dform__jsp.java:333){noformat}

When trying to render {{filter-form.jsp}}, the rendering of the Status field depends on which projects are selected. However, if bad project ids are specified through a URL, this will result in a null Project object being used deep in workflow scheme code, which causes the IllegalArgumentException.
fields.summary: Referencing invalid project id in search request URL causes Statuses edit fields to not appear in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14857].
  {panel}

It would be valuable to allow more than one Issue Security Level. This would reduce the need for multiple levels to match the different combinations of Roles.  

For example, my company would like to create a Infrastructure Upgrades project.  This project will involve many outside consultants and internal staff.  I can use roles for permissions, and I can create the following issue security levels based on the roles we have - a sampling could be
         Omniware Internal
         Sales
         Network Admin
         External Gui
         External Web Services
         External Developers

This allows me to create issues for Sales people only that NetworkAdmins can not view.

If I want to assign an issue that both the Sales and Network Admin roles can see (e.g. a task relating to a product install at a client site), I would then need to create another security level for Sales_and_Network.  

So, if I have 5 levels representing 5 types of 'employees/security levels', I need to create 5 factorial (120!) levels to allow for all the different combinations.  

Instead, I would prefer to simply select multiple security levels for an issue, i.e. "Allow the Sales and Network Admin levels to view this issue"
fields.summary: Allow multiple Issue Security levels to be selected

fields.description:
At the login screen, when we click on 'Remember my login on this computer' and login, everything works well.  When we close the browser without logout, the login should be remember on this computer.  When we try to get back into Jira, here's the bug that we have into our log file.

2008-04-22 20:24:32,548 http-mdc-tomcat-jira14%2F10.129.1.198-80-3 WARN [atlassian.seraph.auth.DefaultAuthenticator] User:  tried to login but they do not have USE permission or weren't found. Deleting cookie.

He enable the property seraph-config.xml
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-10508
        <init-param>
            <param-name>insecure.cookie</param-name>
            <param-value>true</param-value>
        </init-param>

I think that we had the following problem: http://63.246.22.60/browse/SER-117
Thanks in advance,

Benoit Filiatreault
Ubisoft Montreal
fields.summary: Remember my password with LDAP

fields.description:
We should put more descriptive information for the Project Key input field on the Add Project page.

The description should mention that the key:
# describes the project
# is shown to users who do not have permission to see the project
# used for each issue in the project and therefore should be easy to type (maybe not too long)
# cannot be changed once the project exists

We will also need to update the JIRA doc.
fields.summary: Change the message on the Add Project page for the Key input field

fields.description:
Our JIRA version is 3.12.
I worked on the Clone and Move Plugin and it worked good.
The feature that Iam loking for is
After I link an issue, When I add a comment on either of the Linked issues, the added Comments should reflect in both the Parent and the Child Issue. 
(Or an additional tab to be placed next to Change History as Linked Comments and display all the Available Comments from the Linked Issue)
Has anyone worked on something similar to this?
Plaese help. 
Thanks,
Neelima
fields.summary: Add Comments on an issue should also Add the Comments to the Linked Issue

Our JIRA version is 3.12.

The feature that Iam loking for is

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be nice to be able to configure the screen *Worklog* ; for exemple : have the description with a wiki renderer.

Thanks,
fields.summary: configure the 'Work description'

fields.description:
At the moment, the website:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/JIRADownloadCenter.jspa
hides the EAR/WAR downloads by default as we would like most users to use the Standalone distribution.

However, it is possible to get confused (see JRA-14838) when looking at:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.12/install-war.html
and then downloading the Standalone distribution.

We should ensure that the EAR/WAR installation page:
http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.12/install-war.html
clearly describes that the EAR/WAR distribution, and not Standalone, needs to be downloaded.

We should leave the warning that we do strongly advise to install Standalone.
fields.summary: Update EAR/WAR installation doc to indicate how to download the EAR/WAR distribution

fields.description:
When quoting the issue number of a resolved issue in a text field, a strikethrough effect is applied. In Internet Explorer, the strikethrough effect makes it very difficult to distinguish zeroes and eights. For example: JRA-808

In Firefox there is no problem as the strikethrough appears lower in the text.
fields.summary: Zero and Eight difficult to distinguish in Internet Explorer on resolved "strike-through" issue numbers

fields.description:
It seems that when transitioning an issue there are some problems.  Steps to replicate:

# Create new project and 2 users (e.g. 'admin' [Administrator] and 'a' [normal user])
# Create one issue and let 'a' be the assignee
# Use the default JIRA workflow where the {{Start Progress}} transition has a condition called *Only the assignee of the issue can execute this transition*
# Run this Jelly script:
{noformat}<jira:TransitionWorkflow key="TST-1" user="a" workflowAction="Start Progress"  />{noformat}
This Jelly will fail.   

* 'admin' does not have the action to "Start Progress"
* Once the condition is removed, the Jelly runs
fields.summary: Jelly Tag (TransitionWorkflow) Not Working

fields.description: The [Edit Default Value|http://localhost:8090/jira/secure/admin/EditCustomFieldDefaults!default.jspa?fieldConfigId=10010&fieldConfigSchemeId=10010&returnUrl=ConfigureCustomField%21default.jspa%3FcustomFieldId%3D10000&customFieldId=10000] link leads to the action (see screenshot), but there are no controls other than the *Set Default* and *Cancel* buttons. Neither of which appear to effect the default value of the custom field.
fields.summary: Unable to set default value for checkbox type Custom Fields

fields.description: Test JIRA on Oracle 11g  to ensure that it's compatible.
fields.summary: Testing the compatibility of JIRA with Oracle 11g

fields.description: This request is to track interest in making shared filters standard across all JIRA editions. See the 'Sharing an Issue Filter' section of http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.11/issue_filters.html and comparison at http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/comparison.jsp
fields.summary: Offer shared filters in JIRA Standard
Trusted authentication doesn't correctly determine remote IP address with mod_proxy

fields.description:
There's a couple of issues with the ViewProfilePanel plugin point:
* The module descriptor doesn't call init(this) on the module being created which means the module itself doesn't have access to any of the plugin resources the descriptor makes available
* The webwork property tag doesn't define escape='false' 

There's also an improvement:
* The getHtml() method should pass along the user whose profile page is being viewed.  It makes sense for plugins of this type to be given this information.
fields.summary: ViewProfilePanel plugin point is broken

fields.description:
It would be very useful if a user could use logical operator (e.g. AND, OR) and groupping when configuring permissions on Permissions configuration screen (similar way it is implemented for Conditions on Workflow configuration sceen) .
For example:

When an project issue is assigned, the list of users in Assignee drop-down field should ideally contain only those who are:

* developers (members JIRA buil-in Developers project role - assigned by default to JIRA build-in developers global user group) 
* members of that project (members of that project user group) 

Unfortunately adding to Assignable User permission Developers project role and that project user group does not do the job
as instead of AND logical operator OR one is used and there is no way to changed that (specify AND instead of OR).
So, in our case if a user is a developer but from another project user group he/she will still be displayed as an option in Assignee drop-down field. 
Adding specific users into a group (e.g. Group 1) which you can then associate with the "Assignable User" permission looks like a workaround and 
not a real solution.

Also if complex permissions are to be utilized grouping could be useful.
fields.summary: Implement using of logical operators on Permissions Confuguration screen

fields.description: On the ViewWorkflowTransition screen, any workflow validators, postfunctions etc. that cannot be found on the classpath should be indicated with a "problem style" e.g. a red box and message.
fields.summary: Workflow validators and functions that are not on classpath should be indicated as broken
Create a "test POP Account" button so an admin can verify that JIRA can read the POP/IMAP email account

fields.description:
Take a look, for example, at http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.12/install-war.html .

In there, it refers to instructions in README.txt, which only talks about the standalone deployment.

Follow from install-war.html to http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/v3.12/config_overview.html .

The file layout in there isn't even accurate. FTR, the current unpacked 3.12.2 directories look like:
[wyliek@fodevsx4:/proj/fotech-build/wyliek/p4/fotech/shared/jira]$ ll atlassian-jira-enterprise-3.12.2-standalone/
total 64
-rw-rw----  1 wyliek fodev  688 Feb 11 23:02 NOTICE
-rw-rw----  1 wyliek fodev 3024 Feb 11 22:39 README.html
-rw-rw----  1 wyliek fodev 1952 Feb 11 22:39 README.txt
drwxrws--x 13 wyliek fodev 4096 Apr 18 16:37 atlassian-jira/
drwxrws--x  2 wyliek fodev 4096 Apr 18 16:37 bin/
drwxrws--x  6 wyliek fodev 4096 Apr 18 16:37 common/
drwxrws--x  3 wyliek fodev 4096 Apr 18 16:37 conf/
drwxrws--x  2 wyliek fodev 4096 Apr 18 16:37 external-source/
drwxrws--x  2 wyliek fodev 4096 Apr 18 16:37 licenses/
drwxrws--x  2 wyliek fodev 4096 Feb 11 23:02 logs/
drwxrws--x  4 wyliek fodev 4096 Apr 18 16:37 server/
drwxrws--x  4 wyliek fodev 4096 Apr 18 16:37 shared/
drwxrws--x  2 wyliek fodev 4096 Apr 18 16:37 temp/
drwxrws--x  2 wyliek fodev 4096 Apr 18 16:37 tomcat-docs/
drwxrws--x  2 wyliek fodev 4096 Feb 11 23:02 webapps/
drwxrws--x  2 wyliek fodev 4096 Feb 11 23:02 work/


Note the lack of build.xml and the fact that the docs don't accurately state what this directory should look like at all.
fields.summary: WAR deployment documentation is out of date and incorrect
Wiki format: allow the target of a link to open in a separate tab / window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-14836].
  {panel}

When internal JIRA user management is used, JIRA does not allow users to be deleted if they have reported issues or have issues assigned to them.

Due to this, some sub-systems in JIRA expect that if a user is an assignee or a reporter of an issue, then the user must exist.

This is much harder to enforce when external user management is used. For example, Crowd.

Therefore, JIRA needs to be changed to relax this constraint.

*Issues:*
* Inconsistent Stats - In Browse project, issues under the unassigned bucket may show wrong results.  This is due to the null value being mapped to the non-existent user instead of unassigned.
* Editing an issue where it is assigned to non-existent user will blow every time the issue is edited.
fields.summary: Ensure JIRA behaves correctly when a user who has assigned or reported issues has been deleted

fields.description:
When uploading a file that has double quotes around its filename and one of the double quotes has been deleted, the filename is treated as if it was not entered at all - other files, if specified, get uploaded without an error, if single file only, you get a message asking for at least one file to upload.

On IE, the Attach button does not do anything.

- Opera (9.26, Win) puts double quotes around the filename by default.
- Firefox (2, Win) does not put double quotes around the filename by default, but user can enter it manually.
- Internet Explorer (7, Win) does not put double quotes around the filename by default, but user can enter it manually.

Usually, when the file uploaded does not exist, the user receives an error message.
fields.summary: Uploading file with invalid filename that inludes double quotes does not generate an error message

fields.description:
In our use case an "Assign to reporter" link next to the "Assign to me" link in the "Resolve Issue" dialog would really help a lot.

Keep up the good work :)

best,
Marcus
fields.summary: "Assign to reporter" link in "Resolve Issue"
Don't allow comments to stretch the whole page vertically

fields.description:
I have a task which I want to convert into a sub-task.  I viewed the task and the parent issue to which it was going to be associated in the same session, then clicked 'Convert to sub-task' from the Operations menu.

This brought up the screen on which you enter the issue key or select the issue.

I clicked on 'Select parent issue' and on the screen which followed, 'Recent issues' was greyed out, and the text displayed 'No issues in your history'.

It seems to me that this would probably display the recently viewed issues.

Thanks

Stuart
fields.summary: Parent issue selection when converting to sub-task does not show recently viewed issues

After deploying 3.12.3 to JAC we have noticed the following in the logs:

2008-04-16 23:23:40,012 resin-tcp-connection-j2ee.jira.atlassian.com:8080-37 WARN [velocity] org.apache.velocity.runtime.exception.ReferenceException: reference : template = templates/plugins/issueviews/single-word.vm [line 437,column 91
] : $textutils.htmlEncode($comment.roleLevel) is not a valid reference.

        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIfStatement.render(ASTIfStatement.java:89)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:55)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.Foreach.render(Foreach.java:166)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTDirective.render(ASTDirective.java:114)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTBlock.render(ASTBlock.java:55)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTIfStatement.render(ASTIfStatement.java:70)
        at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:230)
        at org.apache.velocity.Template.merge(Template.java:256)

fields.summary: $comment.roleLevel is not a valid reference errors in logs

fields.description: Dashboard page tabs should be able to expand beyond the horizontal width of the screen, either by wrapping or scrolling or providing a vertical tab mode which may scale better.
fields.summary: Dashboards with a large number of portal pages cause the page to become too wide

fields.description:
The doc page [Connecting JIRA to DB2|http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/databases/db2.html] should have a note informing users that the database user needs to have assigned a default schema.

Also, if the db user has a default db schema associated with him, I would imagine that for most users, there isn't a need to specify the schema in {{enitityengine.xml}} .

{noformat}
...
<datasource name="defaultDS" field-type-name="db2"
      schema-name="DB2INST1"
      helper-class="org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericHelperDAO"
...
{noformat}
fields.summary: Extra note about installing JIRA on DB2 is needed.

fields.description:
When configuring jira to use a DB2 database as described at http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/latest/databases/db2.html the schema initialization fails. The tables are created correctly, but index creation fails with errors like these:
{noformat}
2008-04-09 11:49:59,791 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Could not create declared indices for entity "OSGroup"
2008-04-09 11:49:59,791 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE INDEX osgroup_name ON JIRALAB.groupbase (groupname)
Error was: com.ibm.db2.jcc.b.nm: DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-552, SQLSTATE=42502, SQLERRMC=JIRATEST;IMPLICIT CREATE SCHEMA, DRIVER=3.50.152
2008-04-09 11:49:59,794 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] Could not create declared indices for entity "OSMembership"
2008-04-09 11:49:59,794 main [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE INDEX mshipbase_user ON JIRALAB.membershipbase (USER_NAME)
Error was: com.ibm.db2.jcc.b.nm: DB2 SQL Error: SQLCODE=-552, SQLSTATE=42502, SQLERRMC=JIRATEST;IMPLICIT CREATE SCHEMA, DRIVER=3.50.152
SQL Exception while executing the following:
CREATE INDEX mshipbase_group ON JIRALAB.membershipbase (GROUP_NAME)
{noformat}

_Error: SQLCODE=-552, SQLSTATE=42502_ is returned when a database user DOES NOT HAVE THE PRIVILEGE TO PERFORM OPERATION as per http://www.rikipedia.co.za/index.php/DB2_SQL_Error_Codes.

JIRA specifies the schema name from enitityengine.xml when creating the tables, but it does not seem to specify the schema name when creating the indexes.
If the database user doesn't have default schema associated with it, JIRA fails to create indexes.

If the default Schema property is specified on the data source definition the default one is specified when JIRA does not do provide it. So, that is why in some/most cases JIRA is able to create the db correctly.

This problem was reported as a feedback by one of customers and successfully replicated in a testing instance.
fields.summary: JIRA fails to create database indexes on db2, if there isn't default db schema

fields.description:
According to [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Plugins+with+Object+Configurable+Parameters], you can create a configuration property with type 'user' that will display as a text box with a user picker pop-up. However, this doesn't work for portlets. If you try, it throws an exception:

fields.summary: Support 'user' configuration property type in portlets

fields.description: Please provide the option to add CONFLUENCE's WYSIWYG editor like widget to all the editable input text area. Very often, our users just copy and past the text from other document, which end up as some unwanted rendering formatted text.
fields.summary: Options to add WYSIWYG editor to all editable input text area
Notification for when issues are voted on
